task.title: Object Details
task.shortdesc: This page allows you to perform a variety of operations associated with objects within buckets.

task.title: Object summary
task.shortdesc: The Object section provides a summary of the object, including its identifiers and a link to view it. The object Name is the only editable field but its extension cannot be changed.

task.title: Actions menu
task.shortdesc: Clicking the Actions menu displays the options to download, copy, or delete the object.

taskbody.context: The Download option allows you to download the object to a specified location on your local file system. A copy of the file remains on S3 until it is deleted from S3 itself.
The Copy option allows you to copy an object along with all of its attributes from one bucket to another.
taskbody.result: If copying an object to the same bucket, change the object's metadata, storage class, website redirect location or encryption attributes first.

taskbody.context: The Delete option allows you to delete the object.

Each object has a set of attributes. These attributes identify the object by its key and contain metadata about its size, creation and modified dates, encoding type, encryption, and other pieces of information that allow S3 to process it. Metadata can be system-defined or user-defined.
For more information about object metadata, go to Object Key and Metadata.
To edit object metadata, you can delete existing metadata or add a metadata pair:

substep.cmd: Select a key from the Key drop-down list box or define your own key by typing it in the Key search field and click Add metadata from the list box.
Select a value for the selected key from the Value drop-down list box.
Click Add Metadata Pair to acknowledge the message and continue.

step.cmd: To remove an existing metadata pair, click the x next to the pair listed under the Metadata heading.

taskbody.context: The sharing settings dictate whether a particular account has acccess your object.

step.cmd: To edit the sharing settings, select from the following:

substep.cmd: Select Public to allow everyone access to your object.
substep.info: Newly-created objects have a default sharing setting of Public. You can change an object's sharing setting to private. See the Example section of this help page.

info.note: Making an object (or file) public means anyone who has the URL can access the object, even if they are not authenticated users.

substep.cmd: Select Private to allow only those specified to access your object.
substep.stepresult: The Share with others section displays only if Private was chosen as the Sharing option for this object.

step.cmd: Specify access control parameters by performing the following:

substep.cmd: Select Use canned ACL to use a pre-defined Access Control List established by your organization.

info.note: For more information about ACL, go to Access Control List (ACL) Overview.

substep.cmd: To change to another pre-defined ACL, select an ACL from the Use canned ACL drop-down list box.
Select Manually define sharing to grant only specific accounts certain levels of access to your object.

info.note: In order to manually define sharing with other accounts, specify that account with an account ID or an email address associated with a user in the account. To obtain an account ID, coordinate with the owners or administrators of those accounts. Otherwise, specifying an email address of a user in the account will effectively grant access to everyone in that account.
You can remove an existing account and permission pair by clicking on the x next to the pair listed under the Manually define sharing option.

substep.cmd: Enter the 12-digit account ID or email address of a user in the account in the Account field.
Select the appropriate level of access for the account by selecting it from the Permissions drop-down list box.
Click the Add Account or Add another account button (if one or more accounts were already present) to add it to the list of accounts with which your object is shared.

step.cmd: When done, click the Save Changes button to save your work, or click Cancel to abandon your changes.

taskbody.context: In this example, change an object marked public to private:

step.cmd: From the Sharing section, select the Private option.
Click the x next to the AllUsers: READ account-permission pair listed under the Manually define sharing option to remove it.
Click the Save Changes button to save your changes.
